page.title: 10THE POLICE IN SHIPSTON
page.content: { The Police Station}at Shipston-on- Stour deals with an area from Ilmington in the west to Brailes in the east,and from Newbold in the north to Long Compton in the south. The station has one{sergeant}and nine constables.The sergeant makes sure that the men do their work properly. He also deals with the paper-work. All the information is stored in the computer.Every morning he reads what happened the night before. The sergeant works from 9 a.m.until 5 p.m. The station has an area{car,}which is a Rover because a fast car is sometimes needed.The constables drive vans, some are called "kennels."They carry dogs or equipment. Some men walk the{beat}so that people will get to know them better.
